trans-unit.source: Exchange connector for on-premises EAS | Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Exchange connector for on-premises EAS | Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: Use the Connector tool to enable communication between the Intune admin console and on-premises Exchange Server for Exchange ActiveSync MDM.
trans-unit.target: Use the Connector tool to enable communication between the Intune admin console and on-premises Exchange Server for Exchange ActiveSync MDM.

trans-unit.source: Install the Intune on-premises Exchange Connector
trans-unit.target: Install the Intune on-premises Exchange Connector

trans-unit.source: To set up a connection that enables Microsoft Intune to communicate with the Exchange Server that hosts the mobile devices’ mailboxes, you must download and configure the On-Premises Connector tool from the Intune administrator console.
trans-unit.target: To set up a connection that enables Microsoft Intune to communicate with the Exchange Server that hosts the mobile devices’ mailboxes, you must download and configure the On-Premises Connector tool from the Intune administrator console.

trans-unit.source: Intune only supports one Exchange connector connection of any type per subscription.
trans-unit.target: Intune only supports one Exchange connector connection of any type per subscription.

trans-unit.source: Requirements for the On-Premises Connector
trans-unit.target: Requirements for the On-Premises Connector

trans-unit.source: The following table lists the requirements for the computer where you install the on-premises Exchange Connector.
trans-unit.target: The following table lists the requirements for the computer where you install the on-premises Exchange Connector.

trans-unit.source: Requirement
trans-unit.target: Requirement

trans-unit.source: More information
trans-unit.target: More information

trans-unit.source: Operating systems
trans-unit.target: Operating systems

trans-unit.source: Intune supports the on-premises Exchange Connector on a computer that runs any edition of Windows Server 2008 SP2 64 bit, Windows Server 2008 R2, Windows Server 2012, or Windows Server 2012 R2.
trans-unit.target: Intune supports the on-premises Exchange Connector on a computer that runs any edition of Windows Server 2008 SP2 64 bit, Windows Server 2008 R2, Windows Server 2012, or Windows Server 2012 R2.

trans-unit.source: The connector is not supported on any Server Core installation.
trans-unit.target: The connector is not supported on any Server Core installation.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Exchange version
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Exchange version

trans-unit.source: Either on-premises Connector requires Microsoft Exchange 2010 SP1 or later, or legacy Exchange Online Dedicated.
trans-unit.target: Either on-premises Connector requires Microsoft Exchange 2010 SP1 or later, or legacy Exchange Online Dedicated.

trans-unit.source: To determine whether your Exchange Online Dedicated environment is in the **new** or **legacy** configuration, contact your account manager.
trans-unit.target: To determine whether your Exchange Online Dedicated environment is in the **new** or **legacy** configuration, contact your account manager.

trans-unit.source: Mobile device management authority
trans-unit.target: Mobile device management authority

trans-unit.source: [Set the mobile device management authority to Intune](get-ready-to-enroll-devices-in-microsoft-intune.md#set-mobile-device-management-authority).
trans-unit.target: [Set the mobile device management authority to Intune](get-ready-to-enroll-devices-in-microsoft-intune.md#set-mobile-device-management-authority).

trans-unit.source: Hardware
trans-unit.target: Hardware

trans-unit.source: The computer where you install the connector requires a 1.6 GHz CPU with 2 GB ram and 10 GB of free disk space minimum hardware.
trans-unit.target: The computer where you install the connector requires a 1.6 GHz CPU with 2 GB ram and 10 GB of free disk space minimum hardware.

trans-unit.source: Active Directory Synchronization
trans-unit.target: Active Directory Synchronization

trans-unit.source: Before you can use either Connector to connect Intune to your Exchange Server, you must [set up Active Directory synchronization](/intune/get-started/start-with-a-paid-subscription-to-microsoft-intune-step-3) so that your local users and security groups are synchronized with your instance of Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: Before you can use either Connector to connect Intune to your Exchange Server, you must [set up Active Directory synchronization](/intune/get-started/start-with-a-paid-subscription-to-microsoft-intune-step-3) so that your local users and security groups are synchronized with your instance of Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: Additional software
trans-unit.target: Additional software

trans-unit.source: A full installation of Microsoft .NET Framework 4 and Windows PowerShell 2.0 must be installed on the computer that hosts the connector.
trans-unit.target: A full installation of Microsoft .NET Framework 4 and Windows PowerShell 2.0 must be installed on the computer that hosts the connector.

trans-unit.source: Network
trans-unit.target: Network

trans-unit.source: The computer where you install the connector must be in a domain that has a trust relationship to the domain that hosts your Exchange Server.
trans-unit.target: The computer where you install the connector must be in a domain that has a trust relationship to the domain that hosts your Exchange Server.

trans-unit.source: The computer requires configurations to enable it to access the Intune service through firewalls and proxy servers over Ports 80 and 443.
trans-unit.target: The computer requires configurations to enable it to access the Intune service through firewalls and proxy servers over Ports 80 and 443.

trans-unit.source: Domains used by Intune include manage.microsoft.com, *manage.microsoft.com, and *.manage.microsoft.com.
trans-unit.target: Domains used by Intune include manage.microsoft.com, *manage.microsoft.com, and *.manage.microsoft.com.

trans-unit.source: Hosted Exchange configured and running
trans-unit.target: Hosted Exchange configured and running

trans-unit.source: See [Exchange Server 2016](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/mt170645.aspx) for more information.
trans-unit.target: See [Exchange Server 2016](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/mt170645.aspx) for more information.

trans-unit.source: Exchange cmdlet requirements
trans-unit.target: Exchange cmdlet requirements

trans-unit.source: You must create an Active Directory user account that is used by the Intune Exchange Connector.
trans-unit.target: You must create an Active Directory user account that is used by the Intune Exchange Connector.

trans-unit.source: The account must have permission to run the following required Windows PowerShell Exchange cmdlets:
trans-unit.target: The account must have permission to run the following required Windows PowerShell Exchange cmdlets:

trans-unit.source: Get-ActiveSyncOrganizationSettings, Set-ActiveSyncOrganizationSettings
trans-unit.target: Get-ActiveSyncOrganizationSettings, Set-ActiveSyncOrganizationSettings

trans-unit.source: Get-CasMailbox, Set-CasMailbox
trans-unit.target: Get-CasMailbox, Set-CasMailbox

trans-unit.source: Get-ActiveSyncMailboxPolicy, Set-ActiveSyncMailboxPolicy, New-ActiveSyncMailboxPolicy, Remove-ActiveSyncMailboxPolicy
trans-unit.target: Get-ActiveSyncMailboxPolicy, Set-ActiveSyncMailboxPolicy, New-ActiveSyncMailboxPolicy, Remove-ActiveSyncMailboxPolicy

trans-unit.source: Get-ActiveSyncDeviceAccessRule, Set-ActiveSyncDeviceAccessRule, New-ActiveSyncDeviceAccessRule, Remove-ActiveSyncDeviceAccessRule
trans-unit.target: Get-ActiveSyncDeviceAccessRule, Set-ActiveSyncDeviceAccessRule, New-ActiveSyncDeviceAccessRule, Remove-ActiveSyncDeviceAccessRule

trans-unit.source: Get-ActiveSyncDeviceStatistics
trans-unit.target: Get-ActiveSyncDeviceStatistics

trans-unit.source: Get-ActiveSyncDevice
trans-unit.target: Get-ActiveSyncDevice

trans-unit.source: Get-ExchangeServer
trans-unit.target: Get-ExchangeServer

trans-unit.source: Get-ActiveSyncDeviceClass
trans-unit.target: Get-ActiveSyncDeviceClass

trans-unit.source: Get-Recipient
trans-unit.target: Get-Recipient

trans-unit.source: Clear-ActiveSyncDevice, Remove-ActiveSyncDevice
trans-unit.target: Clear-ActiveSyncDevice, Remove-ActiveSyncDevice

trans-unit.source: Set-ADServerSettings
trans-unit.target: Set-ADServerSettings

trans-unit.source: Get-Command
trans-unit.target: Get-Command

trans-unit.source: Download the on-premises Exchange Connector software installation package
trans-unit.target: Download the on-premises Exchange Connector software installation package

trans-unit.source: On a supported Windows Server operating system for the on-premises Exchange Connector, open the [Microsoft Intune administration console](http://manage.microsoft.com) (http://manage.microsoft.com) with a user account that is an administrator in the Exchange tenant with a license to use Exchange Server.
trans-unit.target: On a supported Windows Server operating system for the on-premises Exchange Connector, open the [Microsoft Intune administration console](http://manage.microsoft.com) (http://manage.microsoft.com) with a user account that is an administrator in the Exchange tenant with a license to use Exchange Server.

trans-unit.source: Open set up Exchange Connection
trans-unit.target: Open set up Exchange Connection

trans-unit.source: In the workspace shortcuts pane, choose **Admin**, choose **Mobile Device Management** > **Microsoft Exchange**, and then choose **Setup Exchange Connection**.
trans-unit.target: In the workspace shortcuts pane, choose **Admin**, choose **Mobile Device Management** > **Microsoft Exchange**, and then choose **Setup Exchange Connection**.

trans-unit.source: On the **Setup Exchange Connection** page, choose **Download On-Premises Connector**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Setup Exchange Connection** page, choose **Download On-Premises Connector**.

trans-unit.source: The on-premises Exchange Connector is contained in a compressed (.zip) folder that can be opened or saved.
trans-unit.target: The on-premises Exchange Connector is contained in a compressed (.zip) folder that can be opened or saved.

trans-unit.source: In the **File Download** dialog box, choose **Save** to store the compressed folder to a secure location.
trans-unit.target: In the **File Download** dialog box, choose **Save** to store the compressed folder to a secure location.

trans-unit.source: Do not rename or move the files within the on-premises Exchange Connector folder.
trans-unit.target: Do not rename or move the files within the on-premises Exchange Connector folder.

trans-unit.source: Moving or renaming the folder's contents will break the installation.
trans-unit.target: Moving or renaming the folder's contents will break the installation.

trans-unit.source: Install and configure the Intune on-premises Exchange Connector
trans-unit.target: Install and configure the Intune on-premises Exchange Connector

trans-unit.source: Perform the following steps to install the Intune on-premises Exchange Connector.
trans-unit.target: Perform the following steps to install the Intune on-premises Exchange Connector.

trans-unit.source: The on-premises Exchange Connector can only be installed once per Intune subscription, and only on one computer.
trans-unit.target: The on-premises Exchange Connector can only be installed once per Intune subscription, and only on one computer.

trans-unit.source: If you try to configure an additional on-premises Exchange Connector, the new connection will replace the original one.
trans-unit.target: If you try to configure an additional on-premises Exchange Connector, the new connection will replace the original one.

trans-unit.source: On a supported operating system for the On-Premises Connector, extract the files in **Exchange_Connector_Setup.zip** to a secure location.
trans-unit.target: On a supported operating system for the On-Premises Connector, extract the files in **Exchange_Connector_Setup.zip** to a secure location.

trans-unit.source: After the files are extracted, open the extracted folder and double-click **Exchange_Connector_Setup.exe** to install the on-premises Exchange Connector.
trans-unit.target: After the files are extracted, open the extracted folder and double-click **Exchange_Connector_Setup.exe** to install the on-premises Exchange Connector.

trans-unit.source: If the destination folder is not a secure location, you should delete the certificate file **WindowsIntune.accountcert** after you install the On-Premises Connector.
trans-unit.target: If the destination folder is not a secure location, you should delete the certificate file **WindowsIntune.accountcert** after you install the On-Premises Connector.

trans-unit.source: In the **Exchange server** field, select your Exchange server environment type, either **On-premises Microsoft Exchange Server** or select **Hosted Microsoft Exchange Server**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Exchange server** field, select your Exchange server environment type, either **On-premises Microsoft Exchange Server** or select **Hosted Microsoft Exchange Server**.

trans-unit.source: Choose your Exchange Server type
trans-unit.target: Choose your Exchange Server type

trans-unit.source: For an on-premises Exchange server, provide either the server name or the fully qualified domain name of the Exchange server that hosts the **Client Access Server** role.
trans-unit.target: For an on-premises Exchange server, provide either the server name or the fully qualified domain name of the Exchange server that hosts the **Client Access Server** role.

trans-unit.source: For a hosted Exchange server, provide the Exchange server address.
trans-unit.target: For a hosted Exchange server, provide the Exchange server address.

trans-unit.source: To find the hosted Exchange server URL:
trans-unit.target: To find the hosted Exchange server URL:

trans-unit.source: Open the Outlook Web App for Office 365.
trans-unit.target: Open the Outlook Web App for Office 365.

trans-unit.source: Choose the “?”
trans-unit.target: Choose the “?”

trans-unit.source: icon at the top left, and select **About**.
trans-unit.target: icon at the top left, and select **About**.

trans-unit.source: Locate the **POP External Server** value.
trans-unit.target: Locate the **POP External Server** value.

trans-unit.source: Choose **Proxy Server** to specify proxy server settings for your hosted Exchange server.
trans-unit.target: Choose **Proxy Server** to specify proxy server settings for your hosted Exchange server.

trans-unit.source: Select **Use a proxy server when synchronizing mobile device information**.
trans-unit.target: Select **Use a proxy server when synchronizing mobile device information**.

trans-unit.source: Enter the **proxy server name** and the **port number** to be used to access the server.
trans-unit.target: Enter the **proxy server name** and the **port number** to be used to access the server.

trans-unit.source: If it is necessary to provide user credentials to access the proxy server, select Use credentials to connect to the proxy server and enter the **domain\user** and the **password**.
trans-unit.target: If it is necessary to provide user credentials to access the proxy server, select Use credentials to connect to the proxy server and enter the **domain\user** and the **password**.

trans-unit.source: Choose **OK**.
trans-unit.target: Choose **OK**.

trans-unit.source: Provide the credentials, **User (Domain\user)** and **Password** necessary to connect to your Exchange server.
trans-unit.target: Provide the credentials, **User (Domain\user)** and **Password** necessary to connect to your Exchange server.

trans-unit.source: Provide administrative credentials necessary to send notifications to a user’s Exchange mailbox.
trans-unit.target: Provide administrative credentials necessary to send notifications to a user’s Exchange mailbox.

trans-unit.source: These notifications are configurable via Conditional Access policies using Intune.
trans-unit.target: These notifications are configurable via Conditional Access policies using Intune.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that the Autodiscover service and Exchange Web Services are configured on the Exchange Client Access Server.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that the Autodiscover service and Exchange Web Services are configured on the Exchange Client Access Server.

trans-unit.source: For more information on that see [Client Access server](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/dd298114.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For more information on that see [Client Access server](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/dd298114.aspx).

trans-unit.source: In the **Password** field, provide the password for this account to enable Intune to access the Exchange Server.
trans-unit.target: In the **Password** field, provide the password for this account to enable Intune to access the Exchange Server.

trans-unit.source: Choose **Connect**.
trans-unit.target: Choose **Connect**.

trans-unit.source: It may take a few minutes while the connection is set up.
trans-unit.target: It may take a few minutes while the connection is set up.

trans-unit.source: During configuration, the Exchange Connector stores your proxy settings to enable access to the Internet.
trans-unit.target: During configuration, the Exchange Connector stores your proxy settings to enable access to the Internet.

trans-unit.source: If your proxy settings change, you will have to reconfigure the Exchange Connector in order to apply the updated proxy settings to the Exchange Connector.
trans-unit.target: If your proxy settings change, you will have to reconfigure the Exchange Connector in order to apply the updated proxy settings to the Exchange Connector.

trans-unit.source: After the Exchange Connector sets up the connection, mobile devices associated with users that are managed in Exchange Connector are automatically synchronized and added to the Exchange Connector.
trans-unit.target: After the Exchange Connector sets up the connection, mobile devices associated with users that are managed in Exchange Connector are automatically synchronized and added to the Exchange Connector.

trans-unit.source: This synchronization may take some time to complete.
trans-unit.target: This synchronization may take some time to complete.

trans-unit.source: If you have installed the on-premises Exchange Connector, and if at some point you delete the Exchange connection, you must uninstall the on-premises Exchange Connector from the computer onto which it was installed.
trans-unit.target: If you have installed the on-premises Exchange Connector, and if at some point you delete the Exchange connection, you must uninstall the on-premises Exchange Connector from the computer onto which it was installed.

trans-unit.source: Validate Exchange connection
trans-unit.target: Validate Exchange connection

trans-unit.source: After you have successfully configured the Exchange Connector, you can view the status of the connection and the last successful synchronization attempt.
trans-unit.target: After you have successfully configured the Exchange Connector, you can view the status of the connection and the last successful synchronization attempt.

trans-unit.source: In the [Microsoft Intune administration console](http://manage.microsoft.com) choose the **ADMIN** workspace, and under **Mobile Device Management**, choose **Microsoft Exchange**, and validate that the details you provided appear under **Exchange Connection Information**.
trans-unit.target: In the [Microsoft Intune administration console](http://manage.microsoft.com) choose the **ADMIN** workspace, and under **Mobile Device Management**, choose **Microsoft Exchange**, and validate that the details you provided appear under **Exchange Connection Information**.

trans-unit.source: You can also check the time and date of the last successful synchronization attempt.
trans-unit.target: You can also check the time and date of the last successful synchronization attempt.
